margin-top: 18pt">ALLIS-CHALMERS ENERGY INC. </DIV> <DIV align="left"> <A name="106"></A> </DIV> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><B>NOTES UNAUDITED CONSOLIDATED CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B></DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>NOTE 1 &#151; NATURE BUSINESS SUMMARY SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Nature Operations</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Allis-Chalmers Energy Inc. subsidiaries (&#147;Allis-Chalmers&#148;, &#147;we&#148;, &#147;our&#148; &#147;us&#148;) multi-faceted oilfield service company services equipment oil natural gas exploration production companies, domestically Texas, Louisiana, New Mexico, Colorado, Oklahoma, Mississippi, Utah, Wyoming, Arkansas, Alabama, West Virginia, offshore Gulf Mexico, internationally, primarily Argentina Mexico. We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: Rental Services; International Drilling; Directional Drilling; Tubular Services; Underbalanced Drilling; Production Services. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We derive operating revenues rates day rates job charge labor equipment required provide service rates day equipment tools rent customers. The price charge services depends factors, including level oil natural gas drilling activity competitive environment geographic regions operate. Contracts awarded based price, quality service equipment general reputation experience personnel. The principal operating costs direct indirect labor benefits, repairs maintenance equipment, insurance, equipment rentals, fuel, depreciation general administrative expenses. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On October&nbsp;25, 2006 Board Directors approved transfer listing common stock American Stock Exchange (&#147;AMEX&#148;) New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;). Our common stock continued trade AMEX symbol &#147;ALY&#148; transfer completed March&nbsp;22, 2007, time began trading NYSE symbol &#147;ALY&#148;. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Basis Presentation</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Our unaudited consolidated condensed financial statements included prepared pursuant rules regulations Securities Exchange Commission, SEC. We presentations disclosures adequate make information misleading. Compensation cost RSAs primarily recognized straight-line basis vesting service period net forfeitures. As March&nbsp;31, 2007, $444,000 total unrecognized compensation cost related nonvested RSAs. We expect approximately $330,000 recognized remainder 2007, approximately $68,000 recognized 2008 approximately $46,000 recognized 2009. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->8<!-- /Folio --> </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>ALLIS-CHALMERS ENERGY INC.<BR> NOTES UNAUDITED CONSOLIDATED CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>NOTE 3 &#151; INCOME PER COMMON SHARE</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We compute income common share accordance provisions SFAS No.&nbsp;128, <I>Earnings Per Share</I>. Basic earnings share computed basis weighted average number shares common stock outstanding period. The senior notes due January&nbsp;15, 2014 bear interest 9.0%. The proceeds fund acquisitions Specialty Rental Tools, Inc., Specialty, DLS Drilling, Logistics &#038; Services Corporation, DLS, repay existing debt general corporate purposes. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On January&nbsp;18, 2006, executed amended restated credit agreement $25.0&nbsp;million revolving line credit maturity January&nbsp;2010. Our January&nbsp;2006 amended restated credit agreement customary events default financial covenants limits ability incur additional indebtedness, make capital expenditures, pay dividends make distributions, create liens sell assets. Our obligations January&nbsp;2006 amended restated credit agreement secured substantially assets located United States. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio --> </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>ALLIS-CHALMERS ENERGY INC.<BR> NOTES UNAUDITED CONSOLIDATED CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>NOTE 6 &#151; DEBT (Continued)</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">On December&nbsp;18, 2006, closed $300.0&nbsp;million senior unsecured bridge loan. MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION ANALYSIS FINANCIAL CONDITION RESULTS OPERATION</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><I>The discussion analysis read conjunction consolidated financial statements notes thereto included report. This report forward-looking statements involve risks uncertainties. Our actual results differ materially results discussed forward-looking statements. Factors differences include, limited to, general condition oil natural gas drilling industry, demand oil natural gas service rental products, competition. For information forward-looking statements refer section entitled&#147;Forward-Looking Statements&#148; page 27.</I> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Overview Our Business</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We multi-faceted oilfield services company services equipment oil natural gas exploration production companies, domestically Texas, Louisiana, New Mexico, Colorado, Oklahoma, Mississippi, Utah, Wyoming, Arkansas, Alabama, West Virginia, offshore Gulf internationally primarily Argentina Mexico. We operate sectors oil natural gas service industry: Rental Services; International Drilling; Directional Drilling; Tubular Services; Underbalanced Drilling; Production Services. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We derive operating revenues rates day rates job charge labor equipment required provide service rates day equipment tools rent customers. The price charge services depends factors, including level oil natural gas drilling activity competitive environment geographic regions operate. Contracts awarded based price, quality service equipment, general reputation experience personnel. The demand drilling services historically volatile affected capital expenditures oil natural gas exploration development companies, fluctuate based prices oil natural gas, expectation prices oil natural gas. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The number working drilling rigs, typically referred &#147;rig count,&#148; important indicator activity levels oil natural gas industry. The rig count United States increased 862 December&nbsp;31, 2002 1,747 April&nbsp;30, 2007 Baker Hughes rig count. Furthermore, directional horizontal rig counts increased 283 December&nbsp;31, 2002 740 April&nbsp;30, 2007, accounted 32.8% 42.3% total U.S. rig count, respectively. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Our cost revenues represents direct indirect costs operation maintenance equipment. The principal elements costs direct indirect labor benefits, repairs maintenance equipment, insurance, equipment rentals, fuel depreciation. Operating expenses fluctuate direct proportion revenues because, factors, fixed base inventory equipment facilities support operations, periods low drilling activity seek preserve labor continuity market services maintain equipment. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Cyclical Nature Equipment Rental Services Industry</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The oilfield services industry highly cyclical. The critical factor assessing outlook industry worldwide supply demand oil domestic supply demand natural gas. The peaks valleys demand cyclical industries. This primarily result industry driven commodity demand price increases. As demand increases, producers raise prices. The price escalation enables producers increase capital expenditures. The increased capital expenditures ultimately result greater revenues profits services equipment companies. The increased capital expenditures ultimately result greater production historically resulted increased supplies reduced prices. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Demand services strong 2004, 2005, 2006 2007, due high oil natural gas prices increased demand declining production costs natural gas compared energy sources. Management believes current market fundamentals indicative favorable long-term trend activity markets. However, factors offset developments affecting worldwide supply demand oil natural gas products. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->20<!-- /Folio --> </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table Contents</A></H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Results Operations</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In December&nbsp;2006, acquired substantially assets Oil &#038; Gas Rental Services, Inc., OGR. We report operations OGR Rental Services segment. In April&nbsp;2006, acquired outstanding stock Rogers Oil Tool Services, Inc., Rogers. We report operations Rogers Tubular Services segment. In August&nbsp;2006, acquired outstanding stock DLS Drilling, Logistics &#038; Services Corporation, DLS, December&nbsp;2006, acquired outstanding stock Tanus Argentina S.A., Tanus. We report operations DLS Tanus International Drilling segment. In October&nbsp;2006, acquired outstanding stock Petro-Rentals, Incorporated, Petro Rentals. We report operations Petro Rentals Production Services segment. We consolidated results acquisitions day acquired. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The foregoing acquisitions affect comparability period period historical results, historical results indicative future results. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U><B>Comparison Three Months Ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 2006</B></U> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Our revenues months ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 $135.9&nbsp;million, increase 183.7% compared $47.9&nbsp;million months ended March&nbsp;31, 2006. Revenues increased business segments due acquisitions completed 2006, investment capital equipment, increased utilization rental equipment, improved pricing opening operating locations. The significant increase revenues due acquisition DLS August&nbsp;14, 2006 expanded operations sixth operating segment, International Drilling. Revenues increased significantly Rental Services segment due OGR acquisition December&nbsp;18, 2006 increased utilization rental equipment. Revenues Production Services segment increased due acquisition Petro-Rentals October&nbsp;17, 2006 addition coil tubing units fourth quarter 2006. Our Tubular Services segment substantial increase revenue, primarily due acquisition Rogers April&nbsp;3, 2006, improved market conditions. Our Directional Drilling segment revenues increased 2007 period compared 2006 period due improved pricing directional drilling purchase additional down-hole motors measurement-while-drilling tools, MWD, tools increased capacity market presence. Revenues increased Underbalanced Drilling segment due purchase additional equipment, principally compressor packages. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Our gross margin quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2007 increased 180.3% $46.5&nbsp;million, 34.2% revenues, compared $16.6&nbsp;million, 34.6%, revenues months ended March&nbsp;31, 2006. The increase gross profit due increase revenues business segments. The decrease gross profit percentage revenues primarily due lower gross margin DLS achieves international drilling segment. The lower margin DLS partly offset acquisition OGR December&nbsp;18, 2006, high margin rental services business, increased utilization rental equipment improved pricing services generally. Also, contributing gross profit margin purchase additional MWD tools, acquisition Rogers Petro Rentals, addition coil tubing units fourth quarter 2006. The increase gross profit partially offset increase depreciation expense 254.8% $11.8&nbsp;million quarter 2007 compared $3.3 million quarter 2006. The increase due additional depreciable assets resulting acquisitions capital expenditures. Our cost revenues consists principally labor costs benefits, equipment rentals, maintenance repairs equipment, depreciation, insurance fuel. Because costs fixed, gross profit percentage revenues generally affected level revenues. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">General administrative expense $14.0&nbsp;million quarter 2007 compared $7.3 million quarter 2006. As percentage revenues, general administrative expenses 10.3% quarter 2007 compared 15.3% quarter 2006. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;123R, <I>Share-Based Payment, </I>effective January&nbsp;1, 2006. (&#147;<B><I>Commerce</I></B>&#148;), assignee, pursuant Royal Bank assigned Commerce portion Royal Bank&#146;s Term Loan Acquisition Loan portion Revolving Loan Revolving Commitment, Commerce Lender Borrower Original Credit Agreement.</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; Subject reliance terms, conditions, representations, warranties Loan Documents, Lender severally, jointly, agrees make revolving loans (each loan &#147;<B><I>Revolving Loan</I></B>&#148;) Borrower time time Business Day period Second Amended Restated Closing Date Maturity Date, aggregate amount exceed time outstanding amount Lender&#146;s Pro Rata Share Revolving Loan Borrowings exceed, aggregated Outstanding Amount L/C Obligations, Lender&#146;s Revolving Commitment. Revolving Loan Borrowings repaid reborrowed time time accordance terms provisions Loan Documents; <I>provided that</I>, Revolving Loan Borrowing occur Business Day Business Day immediately preceding Maturity Date. Revolving Loans Base Rate Loans Eurodollar Rate Loans, provided herein; <I>provided, however, </I>all Revolving Loan Borrowings made Second Amended Restated Closing Date made Base Rate Loans.</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>2.02 Borrowings, Conversions Continuations Revolving Loans.</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Each Borrowing, conversion Revolving Loans interest rate Type other, continuation Revolving Loans interest rate Type made Borrower&#146;s irrevocable notice Administrative Agent, telephone. Each notice received Administrative Agent 11:00&nbsp;a.m., New York time, Business Days prior requested date Borrowing of, conversion continuation Eurodollar Rate Loans, Business Day prior requested date Borrowing of, conversion continuation Base Rate Loans. Each telephonic notice confirmed promptly delivery Administrative Agent written Borrowing Notice, appropriately completed signed authorized officer Borrower. Each Borrowing of, conversion continuation Eurodollar Rate Loans principal amount $500,000 multiple $500,000 excess thereof. Each Borrowing conversion Base Rate Loans principal amount $500,000 multiple $100,000 excess thereof. margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>3.04 Increased Cost Reduced Return; Capital Adequacy; Reserves Eurodollar Rate Loans.</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;If Lender L/C Issuer determines result Change Law, Lender&#146;s L/C Issuer&#146;s compliance therewith, increase cost Lender </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->41<!-- /Folio --> </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; To extent Laws State Texas applicable purposes determining &#147;<I>Maximum Rate</I>&#148; &#147;<I>Maximum Amount</I>,&#148; terms &#147;<I>weekly ceiling</I>&#148; time time effect Texas Finance Code &#167; <I>303.001</I>, limited Texas Finance Code &#167; <I>303.009</I>. The Borrower agrees Chapter&nbsp;346 Texas Finance Code, amended (which regulates revolving credit loan accounts revolving tri-party accounts), apply Obligations. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>10.11 Counterparts</B>. In event conflict provisions Agreement Loan Document, provisions Agreement control; <I>provided </I>the inclusion supplemental rights remedies favor Administrative Agent Lenders Loan Document deemed conflict Agreement. Each Loan Document drafted joint participation respective parties thereto construed favor party, accordance fair meaning thereof. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>10.13 Survival Representations Warranties</B>. Such representations warranties relied Administrative Agent Lender, investigation made Administrative Agent Lender behalf notwithstanding Administrative Agent Lender notice knowledge Default Event Default time Borrowing, continue full force effect long Revolving Loan Obligation remain unpaid unsatisfied. </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->82<!-- /Folio --> </DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>10.14 Severability</B>. margin-top: 18pt">ARTICLE I</DIV> <DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DEFINITIONS</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>SECTION 1.1 </B><U><B>Certain Terms</B></U>. The capitalized terms Guaranty, including preamble recitals, meanings (such definitions equally applicable singular plural forms thereof):</DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B><I>Administrative Agent</I></B>&#148; defined recital. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;<B><I>Borrower</I></B>&#148; defined recital. </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; Each Guarantor absolutely, unconditionally, irrevocably (1)&nbsp;guarantees full punctual payment due, stated maturity, required prepayment, declaration, acceleration, demand otherwise, Obligations Borrower Obligor existing Second Amended Restated Credit Agreement, Notes Loan Document Borrower Obligor party, principal, interest, fees, expenses (including amounts due operation automatic stay <I>Section </I>362(a) United States Bankruptcy Code, 11 U.S.C. &#167;362(a), operation <I>Sections&nbsp;502(b</I>) <I>5</I><I>06(b)</I> United States Bankruptcy Code, 11 U.S.C. &#167;502(b) &#167;506(b)), (2)&nbsp;indemnifies holds harmless Lender holder Note costs expenses (including reasonable attorney&#146;s fees expenses) incurred Lender holder, case be, enforcing rights Guaranty; <I>provided however,</I> Guarantor liable Guaranty maximum amount liability incurred rendering Guaranty, relates Guarantor, voidable applicable law relating fraudulent conveyance fraudulent</DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio --></DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">transfer, greater amount. GUARANTOR HEREBY EXPRESSLY IRREVOCABLY SUBMITS NONEXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION COURTS STATES DISTRICT COURT DISTRICT PURPOSE LITIGATION SET FORTH IRREVOCABLY AGREES BOUND JUDGMENT RENDERED THEREBY CONNECTION LITIGATION. GUARANTOR IRREVOCABLY CONSENTS SERVICE PROCESS PERSONAL SERVICE WITHIN WITHOUT TEXAS. GUARANTOR HEREBY EXPRESSLY IRREVOCABLY WAIVES, FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED LAW, OBJECTION HEREAFTER LAYING VENUE LITIGATION BROUGHT COURT REFERRED CLAIM LITIGATION BROUGHT INCONVENIENT FORUM.</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>SECTION 4.12 </B><U><B>Waiver Jury Trial</B></U><B>. GUARANTOR HEREBY KNOWINGLY, VOLUNTARILY INTENTIONALLY WAIVES RIGHTS A TRIAL JURY RESPECT LITIGATION BASED HEREON, ARISING OF, UNDER, CONNECTION WITH, GUARANTY, COURSE CONDUCT, COURSE DEALING, STATEMENTS (WHETHER VERBAL WRITTEN) ACTIONS LENDERS GUARANTORS. GUARANTOR ACKNOWLEDGES AGREES RECEIVED FULL SUFFICIENT CONSIDERATION PROVISION PROVISION A MATERIAL</B> </DIV> <P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->9<!-- /Folio --></DIV> <!-- PAGEBREAK --> <P><HR noshade><P> <H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P> <DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif"> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>INDUCEMENT LENDERS ENTERING AMENDED RESTATED CREDIT AGREEMENT.</B> </DIV> <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>SECTION 4.13 </B><U><B>Entire Agreement</B></U><B>. GUARANTY DOCUMENTS REPRESENT FINAL AGREEMENT PARTIES CONTRADICTED EVIDENCE PRIOR, CONTEMPORANEOUS, SUBSEQUENT ORAL AGREEMENTS PARTIES.
